tab.name: intro
tab.label: Summary
tab.content: Throughout history the south bank of the Thames in London has been a less affluent area, a melting pot of people and a lively neighbourhood. This is still true today! But it is also true that the roads and passages of Southwark hold many clues to the riches of the past. Surely a great place to explore with a Treasure Hunt?

tab.name: details
tab.label: Hunt Info
tab.content:
Hunts The pack includes a treasure trail and a bonus round.

Duration 2 hours or so, not including breaks.

Suitability Suitable for any size of group from 1 to 8, good for families. The streets of Southwark are accessible to all, and any steps can be detoured around. All the areas explored should be freely accessible in daylight hours.

Requirements Just a pencil and paper, and a sensible pair of shoes.

tab.name: todo
tab.label: Things to do
tab.content:
• Your treasure hunt takes you right through Borough Market, and if it's open there's nowhere better to find snacks or lunch around here
  • At Shakespeare's Globe they perform traditional renditions of the bard's great plays in evocative surroundings
  • The Tate Modern holds a really important collection of modern art in a very unique building
  • Have a look at the Old Operating Theatre Museum for a unique insight into how medicine used to be done
